title: The Fremennik Trials/Quick guide
content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:The Fremennik Trials/Quick guide
 This quick guide has an in-depth guide here.
It contains a more detailed description of dialogue, cutscenes, and storyline.

Details[edit | edit source]

Start point Speak to Brundt the Chieftain (located in the longhall) in Rellekka.
Official difficultyIntermediate
DescriptionCouncil workmen have at last found the time to make repairs to the footbridge that connects Kandarin with the Barbarian town of Rellekka. Do you have what it takes to impress the barbarians who live there, and perhaps be welcomed as an honorary member of their clan?
Official lengthMedium
Requirements
  • If crafting the lyre:
    • 25 Fletching (boostable)
    • 40 Woodcutting (boostable)
    • 40 Crafting (boostable)
  • OR
    • Players can kill Lanzig, Borrokar, Lensa or Freidir to obtain the lyre (1/17 chance)
  • Ability to defeat a level-69 Draugen
  • Ability to defeat a fairly strong warrior without armour, weapons, or spells
Items required
  • 5,252 coins
  • Beer (obtainable during quest)
  • Tinderbox
  • Either a raw shark, raw manta ray, or raw sea turtle
  • If crafting the lyre yourself:
    • Woodcutting axe
    • Knife
    • Potato (obtainable during quest)
    • Onion (obtainable during quest)
    • Cabbage (obtainable during quest)
Recommended
  • 40 Combat level
  • 48 Agility (when locating the Draugen)
  • Some food. If you forgot food, go to Peer the Seer's house and commence with his challenge. Search until you find a red herring. Cook the herring and get a cooked herring with red goop. Drop the goop and search the same place again to receive another red herring. Repeat. You should be able to get enough food to help with your combat tests. Once you use the red goop on the wooden disk from the house, you will no longer be able to search for a Red Herring.
  • Armour and a weapon (note: Ranged is not effective)
  • 3-5 prayer potions
  • Stamina potions
  • A super combat potion or super set
  • Camelot teleport
  • Rellekka teleport or Teleport to House if your house is located in Rellekka
  • 7 Ring of Recoil (only if attempting to defeat Koschei's final form)
Enemies to defeat
  • Koschei the deathless (first three forms)
  • Draugen (level 69)

OPTIONAL

  • Lanzig, Borrokar, Lensa or Freidir (level 48) (multiple times)
Ironman concerns
  • Ironmen without 76 Fishing (boostable) can get a raw shark as a drop from Waterfiends or Mogres ( 32 Slayer (boostable) and completion of Skippy and the Mogres required for the latter). They can also be bought from Rufus' Meat Emporium in Canifis for 221 gp.
{"requirements":"*If crafting the [[lyre]]:\n** <span class=\"scp\" data-skill=\"Fletching\" data-level=\"25\">[[File:Fletching icon.png|21x21px|link=Fletching|alt=Fletching]] 25 [[Fletching]]</span> <sup>(<span title=\"This requirement is boostable\" style=\"cursor:help; text-decoration: underline dotted;\">boostable</span>)</sup>\n** <span class=\"scp\" data-skill=\"Woodcutting\" data-level=\"40\">[[File:Woodcutting icon.png|21x21px|link=Woodcutting|alt=Woodcutting]] 40 [[Woodcutting]]</span> <sup>(<span title=\"This requirement is boostable\" style=\"cursor:help; text-decoration: underline dotted;\">boostable</span>)</sup>\n** <span class=\"scp\" data-skill=\"Crafting\" data-level=\"40\">[[File:Crafting icon.png|21x21px|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 40 [[Crafting]]</span> <sup>(<span title=\"This requirement is boostable\" style=\"cursor:help; text-decoration: underline dotted;\">boostable</span>)</sup>\n* '''OR'''\n** Players can kill [[Lanzig]], [[Borrokar]], [[Lensa]] or [[Freidir]] to obtain the lyre ''(1/17 chance)''\n* Ability to defeat a level-69 [[Draugen]]\n* Ability to defeat a [[Koschei|fairly strong warrior]] without [[armour]], [[weapons]], or [[spells]]","desc":"Council workmen have at last found the time to make repairs to the footbridge that connects Kandarin with the Barbarian town of Rellekka.\n\nDo you have what it takes to impress the barbarians who live there, and perhaps be welcomed as an honorary member of their clan?","difficulty":"Intermediate","kills":"* [[Koschei the deathless]] (first three forms)\n* [[Draugen]] ''(level 69)''\n'''OPTIONAL'''\n* [[Lanzig]], [[Borrokar]], [[Lensa]] or [[Freidir]] ''(level 48)'' (multiple times)","name":"The Fremennik Trials/Quick guide","start":"Speak to [[Brundt the Chieftain]] (located in the longhall) in [[Rellekka]].","length":"Medium","ironman":"* Ironmen without <span class=\"scp\" data-skill=\"Fishing\" data-level=\"76\">[[File:Fishing icon.png|21x21px|link=Fishing|alt=Fishing]] 76 [[Fishing]]</span> <sup>(<span title=\"This requirement is boostable\" style=\"cursor:help; text-decoration: underline dotted;\">boostable</span>)</sup> can get a [[raw shark]] as a drop from [[Waterfiend]]s or [[Mogre]]s (<span class=\"scp\" data-skill=\"Slayer\" data-level=\"32\">[[File:Slayer icon.png|21x21px|link=Slayer|alt=Slayer]] 32 [[Slayer]]</span> <sup>(<span title=\"This requirement is boostable\" style=\"cursor:help; text-decoration: underline dotted;\">boostable</span>)</sup> and completion of [[Skippy and the Mogres]] required for the latter). They can also be bought from [[Rufus' Meat Emporium]] in [[Canifis]] for 221 gp.","items":"* 5,252 [[coins]]\n* [[Beer]] (obtainable during quest)\n* [[Tinderbox]]\n* Either a [[raw shark]], [[raw manta ray]], or [[raw sea turtle]]\n* If crafting the lyre yourself:\n** Woodcutting [[axe]]\n** [[Knife]]\n** [[Potato]] (obtainable during quest)\n** [[Onion]] (obtainable during quest)\n** [[Cabbage]] (obtainable during quest)"}

Walkthrough[edit | edit source]

Starting out[edit | edit source]

  • Talk to Brundt in the longhall to start the quest. (Fairy ring DKS and run south-west to Rellekka) ( 3•1•1)…
    3Do you have any quests?
    1Yes, I am interested.
    1I want to become a Fremennik!
    , or ( 2•3•1•1)…
    2Ask about anything else.
    3Do you have any quests?
    1Yes, I am interested.
    1I want to become a Fremennik!
    if started or finished Mountain Daughter
  • The trials may be done in any order, however this quick guide will show you the fastest order.

Manni the Reveller, Sigli the Huntsman, and Olaf the Bard[edit | edit source]

  • Talk to Manni the Reveller while in the longhall. ( 1)…
    1Yes
  • Take the keg of beer and challenge Manni to a drinking contest. You will lose. ( 1)…
    1Yes
  • If you did not bring a beer, grab the beer tankard now.
  • Talk to Sigli the Huntsman outside, near the entrance of the longhall, to obtain the Hunters' Talisman. ( 1•1)…
    1What's a Draugen?
    1Yes
  • Talk to Olaf the Bard just east of the longhall. ( 1)…
    1Yes
  • Talk to Olaf again. ( 4)…
    4I don't need a reminder
  • To get a lyre, either make it yourself (Requires 25 40 40 and 6 free inventory spaces) or kill Lanzig (1/17 drop rate). Killing lanzig takes longer on average. You must enchant it either way.
    • Option 1: Making the lyre yourself (Items required: Axe of any kind, knife)
      • Walk to the Swaying tree that is east of the entrance to Rellekka (north-west of the Golden Apple Tree at AJR) at the rare trees icon. Chop a branch and fletch an unstrung lyre.
      • Talk to Lalli to the south-east of the Swaying tree, ask about the other human. ( 1)…
        1Other human?
      • Talk to Askeladden just outside the longhall entrance to get a pet rock.
      • Pick a cabbage, potato, and onion from the farming patch in the south-east corner of Rellekka.
      • Return to Lalli, and offer the pet rock.
      • Use the cabbage, potato, onion, and pet rock on Lalli's Stew (cauldron).
      • Talk to Lalli again to get the golden fleece.
      • Spin the golden fleece on a spinning wheel and use it on the unstrung lyre. (See the next section to spin the wool)
    • Option 2: Killing Lanzig (takes a long time with bad luck)
      • Lanzig lives in a hut just east of the entrance to the longhall. Kill Lanzig until he drops the lyre (1/17 drop rate). Safespottable at the firepit or outside his door.

Seers' Village[edit | edit source]

  • Teleport to Camelot or walk to Seers' Village.
  • If you are making the lyre yourself:
    • Spin the golden fleece into a ball of golden wool while in Seers' Village (upstairs in a house south of the bank).
    • Use the golden wool on your unstrung lyre.
  • Go to the Seers' Village pub and talk to the Poison Salesman to buy a low alcohol keg for 250 coins. ( 2•1)…
    2Talk about the Fremennik Trials
    1Yes
  • Buy a regular beer if you forgot to take a beer tankard. ( 2)…
    2Beer please.

Back to Rellekka[edit | edit source]

  • Use a Rellekka house teleport to return, or simply walk back. If walking, left-click on your talisman to check if The Draugen is nearby on your way. If so, kill him.
  • Use the beer, or beer tankard, on the council workman by the bridge south of Rellekka to obtain strange object.
  • Go north across the bridge, then walk a bit west until you see a small narrow path heading south into the water. (The large rib cage sticking out of the water on the left side of the bridge)
  • Use your raw shark/manta ray/sea turtle on the strange altar to enchant your lyre.
  • Follow your talisman by left-clicking on it and kill The Draugen now if you haven't already. Appears as a grey butterfly prior to locating the correct tile.
  • Once done, head back into Rellekka and talk to Sigli at the entrance.
  • Head to the outside of the longhall to the pipe on the eastern wall. Use a tinderbox on your strange object and use the lit strange object on the pipe.
  • Enter the north-eastern back door of the longhall, walk onto the stage, and play your enchanted lyre.
  • Exit the back door, enter the main long hall, and take a keg of beer off the table.
  • Use your low alcohol keg on the keg of beer.
  • Challenge Manni to a drinking contest again. ( 1)…
    1Yes

Sigmund the Merchant and Swensen the Navigator[edit | edit source]

  • Talk to Sigmund The Merchant in the market west of the longhall. ( 1)…
    1Yes
  • Talk to the Sailor on the docks to the north-west. ( 1)…
    1Ask about the Merchant's trial
  • Talk to Olaf the Bard just east of the longhall. ( 1)…
    1Ask about the Merchant's trial
  • Talk to Yrsa at the clothing store west of the market. ( 1)…
    1Ask about the Merchant's trial
  • Talk to Brundt the Chieftain in the longhall. ( 1)…
    1Ask about the Merchant's trial
    or ( 2•1)…
    2Ask about anything else
    1Ask about the Merchant's trial
    if you are doing or have finished Mountain Daughter
  • Talk to Sigli the Huntsman just south of the longhall. ( 1)…
    1Ask about the Merchant's trial
  • Talk to Skulgrimen in the hut just north of the longhall. ( 1)…
    1Ask about the Merchant's trial
  • Talk to the Fisherman north of the market. ( 1)…
    1Ask about the Merchant's trial
  • Talk to Swensen the Navigator in the building south of the market. ( 1)…
    1Ask about the Merchant's trial
  • Talk to Swensen again. ( 2•1)…
    2Ask about becoming a Fremennik
    1Yes
  • Climb down the ladder and take the South, West, East, North, South, East, then North portals. Climb up the ladder.
  • Talk to Peer the Seer just north-west of Swensen. ( 1)…
    1Ask about the Merchant's trial
  • Talk to Thorvald the Warrior in the hut just north of the longhall. ( 1)…
    1Ask about the Merchant's trial
  • Talk to Manni the Reveller in the longhall. ( 1)…
    1Ask about the Merchant's trial
  • Talk to Thora the Barkeep in the longhall. ( 1)…
    1Ask about the Merchant's trial
  • Talk to Askeladden in front of the longhall, pay him 5,000 coins. ( 1•1)…
    1Ask about the Merchant's trial
    1Yes
  • Head back and talk to (in order):
    • Thora
    • Manni
    • Thorvald
    • Peer
    • Swensen
    • Fisherman
    • Skulgrimen
    • Sigli
    • Brundt
    • Yrsa
    • Olaf
    • Sailor
    • Sigmund

Thorvald the Warrior[edit | edit source]

  • Go to a bank (The Seers' Village bank is close) and deposit all of your items (you cannot have any weapons, armour, or runes).
  • Bring equipment for the fight:
    • A dramen branch (Note: Requires 31 and must have started lost city), celastrus bark (requires 40 ), or an event rpg
    • A knife (optional - only bring if you are not using an event rpg)
    • A stat boosting amulet
    • A Combat bracelet
    • Plenty of food, potions, and rings of recoil
  • Talk to Thorvald just north of the longhall. ( 1)…
    1Yes
  • Climb down the ladder. If you have a knife and dramen branch, cut it into a staff and equip it. You can also use celastrus bark to fletch a battlestaff.
  • Fight the first 3 forms of Koschei the Deathless without weapons, armour, or runes. (You can pray flick him for the first 3 forms, but be careful as dying in these forms is dangerous for Hardcore Ironmen AND Group Hardcore Ironmen).
  • You can choose to let the 4th form kill you (this IS safe for Hardcore Ironmen AND Group Hardcore Ironmen as Koschei will not actually finish you in this form; the player will faint and wake up upstairs rather than being killed), or you can kill it (slower to this and not necessary).
  • Talk to Thorvald again.

Peer the Seer[edit | edit source]

  • Talk to Peer the Seer southwest of the market. ( 1•1)…
    1Yes
    1Yes
    • He will deposit all your items except anything that is unbankable. (you cannot progress through this part of the quest if anything in your inventory is unbankable).
  • Open the west door to his house, read the riddle.
  • Each line of the riddle gives you one letter of a four-letter word. See the table below for the first riddle line and the related answer.
Riddle Answer

My first is in mage, but not in wizard...

Mind

My first is in tar, but not in a swamp...

Tree

My first is in the well, but not at sea...

Life

My first is in fish, but not in the sea...

Fire

My first is in water, and also in tea...

Time

My first is in wizard, but not in a mage...

Wind
  • Open the door again and climb-up the ladder.
  • Search/study these objects to get a bucket, red disk, wooden disk, jug, and red herring:
    • South-western cupboard (bucket)
    • Unicorn head (red disk)
    • Bull head (wooden disk)
    • Southern chest (jug)
    • Northern bookcase (red herring)
  • Use the red herring on the cooking range.
  • Use the sticky red goop on the wooden disk.
  • Open the trapdoor on the east side, climb-down the trapdoor, and use the two red disks on the abstract mural.
  • Return upstairs and use the bucket on the tap by the cooking range.
  • Use the full bucket on the jug.
  • Use the jug on the drain.
  • Use the 2/5ths bucket on the empty jug.
  • Refill the bucket.
  • Use the full bucket on the 2/3rds jug.
  • Use the 4/5ths bucket on the northern chest with the scale.
  • Fill the vase with water and add the lid.
  • Use the sealed vase on the frozen table.
  • Use the frozen key on the cooking range.
  • Climb-down the eastern trapdoor and you can now open the door to leave.

Finishing up[edit | edit source]

  • Talk to Brundt the Chieftain.

Quest complete!

Rewards[edit | edit source]

  • 3 Quest points
  • 2812.4 Agility experience
  • 2812.4 Attack experience
  • 2812.4 Crafting experience
  • 2812.4 Defence experience
  • 2812.4 Fishing experience
  • 2812.4 Fletching experience
  • 2812.4 Hitpoints experience
  • 2812.4 Strength experience
  • 2812.4 Thieving experience
  • 2812.4 Woodcutting experience
  • Access to the islands of Miscellania, Etceteria, Neitiznot, and Jatizso along with access to the facilities in Rellekka.
  • Ability to wear the Fremennik warrior, berserker, archer, and farseer helms
  • Ability to have Fossegrimen create the enchanted lyre(i)

Required for completing[edit | edit source]

Completion of The Fremennik Trials is required for the following:

  • The Fremennik Isles
  • Throne of Miscellania
  • Olaf's Quest
  • Lunar Diplomacy
  • All tiers of the Fremennik Diary
v • d • e

rawContent:
{{external|rs}}
{{Quick Guide}}

==Details==
{{Quest details page|The Fremennik Trials}}

==Walkthrough==
===Starting out===
{{Checklist|
*Talk to [[Brundt]] in the longhall to start the quest. (Fairy ring {{Fairycode|DKS}} and run south-west to Rellekka) {{Chat option|3Do you have any quests?|1Yes, I am interested.|1I want to become a Fremennik!}}, or {{Chat option|2Ask about anything else.|3Do you have any quests?|1Yes, I am interested.|1I want to become a Fremennik!}} if started or finished [[Mountain Daughter]]
*The trials may be done in any order, however this quick guide will show you the fastest order.
}}
=== Manni the Reveller, Sigli the Huntsman, and Olaf the Bard ===
{{Checklist|
*Talk to [[Manni the Reveller]] while in the longhall. {{Chat option|1Yes}}
*Take the [[Keg of beer (The Fremennik Trials)| keg of beer]] and challenge [[Manni]] to a drinking contest. You will lose. {{Chat option|1Yes}}
*If you did not bring a [[beer]], grab the [[beer tankard]] now.
*Talk to [[Sigli the Huntsman]] outside, near the entrance of the longhall, to obtain the [[Hunters' Talisman]]. {{Chat option|1What's a Draugen?|1Yes}}
*Talk to [[Olaf the Bard]] just east of the longhall. {{Chat option|1Yes}}
*Talk to Olaf again. {{Chat option|4I don't need a reminder}}
*To get a [[lyre]], either make it yourself (Requires {{SCP|Fletching|25}} {{SCP|Woodcutting|40}} {{SCP|Crafting|40}} and 6 free inventory spaces) or kill [[Lanzig]] (1/17 drop rate). Killing lanzig takes '''longer''' on average. You must enchant it either way.
**Option 1: Making the lyre yourself (Items required: Axe of any kind, knife)
***Walk to the [[Swaying tree]] that is east of the entrance to Rellekka (north-west of the [[Golden Apple Tree]] at {{Fairycode|AJR}}) at the rare trees icon. Chop a branch and fletch an [[unstrung lyre]].
***Talk to [[Lalli]] to the south-east of the Swaying tree, ask about the other human. {{Chat option|1Other human?}}
***Talk to [[Askeladden]] just outside the longhall entrance to get a [[pet rock]].
***Pick a cabbage, potato, and onion from the farming patch in the south-east corner of Rellekka.
***Return to Lalli, and offer the pet rock.
***Use the cabbage, potato, onion, and pet rock on [[Lalli's Stew]] (cauldron).
***Talk to Lalli again to get the [[golden fleece]].
***Spin the golden fleece on a spinning wheel and use it on the unstrung lyre. (See the next section to spin the wool)
**Option 2: Killing Lanzig (takes a long time with bad luck)
***[[Lanzig]] lives in a hut just east of the entrance to the longhall. Kill Lanzig until he drops the lyre (1/17 drop rate). Safespottable at the firepit or outside his door.
}}
===Seers' Village===
{{Checklist|
*Teleport to [[Camelot]] or walk to [[Seers' Village]].
*If you are making the lyre yourself:
**Spin the golden fleece into a ball of [[golden wool]] while in Seers' Village (upstairs in a house south of the bank).
**Use the golden wool on your unstrung lyre.
*Go to the Seers' Village pub and talk to the [[Poison Salesman]] to buy a [[low alcohol keg]] for 250 coins. {{Chat option|2Talk about the Fremennik Trials|1Yes}}
*Buy a regular beer if you forgot to take a beer tankard. {{Chat option|2Beer please.}}
}}
===Back to Rellekka===
{{Checklist|
*Use a Rellekka house teleport to return, or simply walk back. If walking, left-click on your talisman to check if [[The Draugen]] is nearby on your way. If so, kill him.
*'''Use''' the beer, or beer tankard, on the council workman by the bridge south of Rellekka to obtain [[strange object]].
*Go north across the bridge, then walk a bit west until you see a small narrow path heading south into the water. (The large rib cage sticking out of the water on the left side of the bridge)
*Use your raw shark/manta ray/sea turtle on the strange altar to enchant your lyre.
*Follow your talisman by left-clicking on it and kill The Draugen now if you haven't already. Appears as a grey butterfly prior to locating the correct tile. 
*Once done, head back into Rellekka and talk to Sigli at the entrance.
*Head to the outside of the longhall to the pipe on the eastern wall. Use a tinderbox on your [[strange object]] and use the [[lit strange object]] on the pipe.
*Enter the north-eastern back door of the longhall, walk onto the stage, and play your [[enchanted lyre]].
*Exit the back door, enter the main long hall, and take a keg of beer off the table.
*Use your [[low alcohol keg]] on the [[keg of beer]].
*Challenge [[Manni]] to a drinking contest again. {{Chat option|1Yes}}
}}

===Sigmund the Merchant and Swensen the Navigator ===
{{Checklist|
*Talk to [[Sigmund The Merchant]] in the market west of the longhall. {{Chat option|1Yes}}
*Talk to the [[Sailor]] on the docks to the north-west. {{Chat option|1Ask about the Merchant's trial}}
*Talk to [[Olaf the Bard]] just east of the longhall. {{Chat option|1Ask about the Merchant's trial}}
*Talk to [[Yrsa]] at the clothing store west of the market. {{Chat option|1Ask about the Merchant's trial}}
*Talk to [[Brundt the Chieftain]] in the longhall. {{Chat option|1Ask about the Merchant's trial}} or {{Chat option|2Ask about anything else|1Ask about the Merchant's trial}} if you are doing or have finished Mountain Daughter
*Talk to [[Sigli the Huntsman]] just south of the longhall. {{Chat option|1Ask about the Merchant's trial}}
*Talk to [[Skulgrimen]] in the hut just north of the longhall. {{Chat option|1Ask about the Merchant's trial}}
*Talk to the [[Fisherman (Rellekka)|Fisherman]] north of the market. {{Chat option|1Ask about the Merchant's trial}}
*Talk to [[Swensen the Navigator]] in the building south of the market. {{Chat option|1Ask about the Merchant's trial}}
*Talk to [[Swensen the Navigator|Swensen]] again. {{Chat option|2Ask about becoming a Fremennik|1Yes}}
*Climb down the ladder and take the '''South''', '''West''', '''East''', '''North''', '''South''', '''East''', then '''North''' portals. Climb up the ladder.
*Talk to [[Peer the Seer]] just north-west of Swensen. {{Chat option|1Ask about the Merchant's trial}}
*Talk to [[Thorvald the Warrior]] in the hut just north of the longhall. {{Chat option|1Ask about the Merchant's trial}}
*Talk to [[Manni the Reveller]] in the longhall. {{Chat option|1Ask about the Merchant's trial}}
*Talk to [[Thora the Barkeep]] in the longhall. {{Chat option|1Ask about the Merchant's trial}}
*Talk to [[Askeladden]] in front of the longhall, pay him 5,000 coins. {{Chat option|1Ask about the Merchant's trial|1Yes}}
*Head back and talk to (in order): 
**Thora
**Manni
**Thorvald
**Peer
**Swensen
**Fisherman
**Skulgrimen
**Sigli
**Brundt
**Yrsa
**Olaf
**Sailor
**Sigmund
}}

===[[Thorvald]] the Warrior===
{{Checklist|
*Go to a bank (The [[Seers' Village]] bank is close) and deposit all of your items (you cannot have any weapons, armour, or runes).
*Bring equipment for the fight:
**A [[dramen branch]] (Note: Requires {{SCP|Crafting|31}} and must have started [[lost city]]), [[celastrus bark]] (requires {{SCP|Fletching|40}}), or an [[event rpg]]
**A knife (optional - only bring if you are not using an event rpg)
**A stat boosting [[amulet]]
**A [[Combat bracelet]]
**Plenty of food, potions, and rings of recoil
*Talk to Thorvald just north of the longhall. {{Chat option|1Yes}}
*Climb down the ladder. If you have a knife and dramen branch, cut it into a staff and equip it. You can also use celastrus bark to fletch a [[battlestaff]].
*Fight the first 3 forms of [[Koschei the Deathless]] without weapons, armour, or runes. (You can pray flick him for the first 3 forms, but '''be careful as dying in these forms is dangerous for Hardcore Ironmen AND Group Hardcore Ironmen''').
*You can choose to let the 4th form kill you ('''this IS safe for Hardcore Ironmen AND Group Hardcore Ironmen as Koschei will not actually finish you in this form; the player will faint and wake up upstairs rather than being killed'''), or you can kill it (slower to this and not necessary).
*Talk to Thorvald again.
}}

===Peer the Seer ===
{{Checklist|title=|
*Talk to Peer the Seer southwest of the market. {{Chat option|1Yes|1Yes}}
**He will deposit all your items except anything that is [[:Category:Unbankable items|unbankable]]. ('''you cannot progress through this part of the quest if anything in your inventory is unbankable''').
*Open the west door to his house, read the riddle.
*Each line of the riddle gives you one letter of a four-letter word. See the table below for the first riddle line and the related answer.
}}

{|class="wikitable lighttable" "
!Riddle
!Answer
|-
|
My first is in mage, but not in wizard...
|Mind
|-
|
My first is in tar, but not in a swamp...
|Tree
|-
|
My first is in the well, but not at sea...
|Life
|-
|
My first is in fish, but not in the sea...
|Fire
|-
|
My first is in water, and also in tea...
|Time
|-
|
My first is in wizard, but not in a mage...
|Wind
|}

{{Checklist|title=|
*Open the door again and climb-up the ladder.
*Search/study these objects to get a bucket, red disk, wooden disk, jug, and red herring:
**South-western cupboard (bucket)
**Unicorn head (red disk)
**Bull head (wooden disk)
**Southern chest (jug)
**Northern bookcase ([[red herring]])
*Use the red herring on the cooking range.
*Use the sticky red goop on the wooden disk.
*Open the trapdoor on the east side, climb-down the trapdoor, and use the two red disks on the [[abstract mural]].
*Return upstairs and use the bucket on the tap by the cooking range.
*Use the full bucket on the jug.
*Use the jug on the drain.
*Use the 2/5ths bucket on the empty jug.
*Refill the bucket.
*Use the full bucket on the 2/3rds jug.
*Use the 4/5ths bucket on the northern chest with the scale.
*Fill the vase with water and add the lid.
*Use the sealed vase on the frozen table.
*Use the frozen key on the cooking range.
*Climb-down the eastern trapdoor and you can now open the door to leave.
}}

===Finishing up===
{{Checklist|
*Talk to Brundt the Chieftain.}}
'''Quest complete!'''

==Rewards==
{{Quest rewards page|The Fremennik Trials}}

==Required for completing==
Completion of The Fremennik Trials is required for the following:

*[[The Fremennik Isles]]
*[[Throne of Miscellania]]
*[[Olaf's Quest]]
*[[Lunar Diplomacy]]
*All tiers of the [[Fremennik Diary]]

{{The Fremennik Trials}}
